column4: someone got 5 minutes of their time to help me configure my ubuntu so i can compile some drivers?
install build-essential and the kernel headers for your running kernel. then you are good to go
what is the error?
source build tree is missing something
how old are these drivers?
exact error
kernel tree is missing autoconfig.h
dpkg -l |grep kernel-header
pastebin the full output of your make run please
cc1: error: /usr/src/kernel-headers-2.6.24-16-server/include/linux/config.h: no such file or directory
lemme guess: it's for asterisk?
that is NOT autoconfig.h! be precise!  and you are missing kernel headers
I asked you for the dpkg output before and you didn't show. show it NOW
come back if you can do what is asked of you. goodbye
a brain
your error message clearly shows you are wrong btw
run configure and pastebin its FULL output
you start by doing what joaopinto asked of you. otherwise you cannot get any help
then pastebin the FULL "make install" output
also the output of: dpkg -l kernel |grep kernel
kernel-package, linux-headers, linux-source
I want the FULL exact output. what you just said is useless. use a pastebin
